cyclone.name: IDALIA
cyclone.current_location: about 195 mi SW of Tampa, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving north toward the Florida Big Bend, then forecast to turn northeast and track along/near the Georgia, South Carolina and North Carolina coasts before emerging into the western Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast near Apalachee Bay

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch from Surf City, NC to the NC/VA border including Pamlico and Albemarle Sounds
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Sebastian Inlet, FL to Surf City, NC; Hurricane Warning Middle of Longboat Key, FL to Indian Pass, FL; Storm Surge Warning Englewood, FL to Indian Pass, FL including Tampa Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf coast (Big Bend), coastal Georgia, South Carolina, North Carolina; indirect impacts possible into southeast Virginia
weather_observation.wind: Gusty conditions possible late Thu night–Fri with occasional tropical-storm-force gusts (30–40 mph) mainly in squalls
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation up to about 2 ft possible along lower Chesapeake Bay and adjacent rivers
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain possible Thursday night into Friday, locally higher in heavier bands
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents along Virginia Beach; low-end tornado risk in outer rain bands
